intro: Psittacanthus oblongifolius, commonly known as the broad-leafed sterculia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers with prominent stamens. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for tropical gardens and botanical collections.
